articles.name: How do I sell ETH or DAI in the BRD app?
articles.title: How do I sell ETH or DAI in the BRD app?
articles.body:
BRD app users in the US now have an easy, convenient, and secure way to sell ether and DAI in the app! Follow these steps to get started:

  1. On the home screen, tap Buy/Sell and at the top of the next screen, toggle the switch to Sell.
  2. Select ETH or DAI from the list of currencies and enter the amount you would like to sell.  You may enter the amount in ETH, DAI, or USD.
  3. Select Bank Transfer as the Payment Method and tap Next.
  4. Review the order details and tap Confirm & Sell to proceed.
  5. Enter your PIN to confirm the sale.

NOTE: In order to sell DAI, users will need to have enough ETH in their BRD app to use as gas.  

If you have questions about selling in the BRD app, or regarding your order, send us an email at support@brd.com.

articles.name: How do I sell bitcoin in the BRD app?
articles.title: How do I sell bitcoin in the BRD app?
articles.body:
BRD app users in the US now have an easy, convenient, and secure way to sell bitcoin in the app! Follow these steps to get started:

  1. On the home screen, tap Buy/Sell and at the top of the next screen, toggle the switch to Sell.
  2. Select BTC from the list of currencies and enter the amount you would like to sell.  You may enter the amount in BTC or in USD.
  3. Select Bank Transfer as the Payment Method and tap Next.
  4. Review the order details and tap Confirm & Sell to proceed.
  5. Enter your PIN to confirm the sale.

If you have questions about selling in the BRD app, or regarding your order, send us an email at support@brd.com.

articles.name: Why is my ethereum or ERC20 token transaction taking too long to send?
articles.title: Why is my ethereum or ERC20 token transaction taking too long to send?
articles.body:
When you send a transaction with the BRD app, it is immediately sent to the network to be confirmed. If your outgoing transaction has been pending for more than 30 minutes, this can be due to the following:

  • The ethereum or ERC20 token wallet needs to be connected to the blockchain
    • Check your internet connection for connectivity issues or security restrictions
  • There is an increase in the number of transactions on the ethereum network causing congestion and delays

articles.name: Why is my bitcoin cash transaction taking too long to send?
articles.title: Why is my bitcoin cash transaction taking too long to send?
articles.body:
When you send a transaction with the BRD app, it is immediately sent to the network to be confirmed. If your outgoing transaction has been pending for more than an hour, this can be due to the following:

  • The bitcoin cash wallet needs to be synced with the blockchain
    • A transaction may not be broadcasted to the bitcoin cash network if the wallet is not synced
    • An out of sync wallet can cause a completed transaction to appear as pending
    • If you are having issues syncing, visit this page
  • There is an increase in the number of transactions on the bitcoin cash network causing congestion and delays

articles.name: Why is my bitcoin transaction taking too long to send?
articles.title: Why is my bitcoin transaction taking too long to send?
articles.body:
When you send a transaction with the BRD app, it is immediately sent to the network to be confirmed. If your outgoing transaction has been pending for more than an hour, this can be due to the following:

  • The bitcoin wallet needs to be synced with the blockchain
    • A transaction may not be broadcasted to the bitcoin network if the wallet is not synced
    • An out of sync wallet can cause a completed transaction to appear as pending
    • If you are having issues syncing, visit this page
  • A low fee setting was selected
    • The fee settings can be changed by tapping on the icon that appears beside the fee after you enter the amount you would like to send
    • There are 3 fee options available: Priority (completes in approximately 30 mins), Regular (completes in approximately 1 hour) and Economy (takes more than an hour to complete) 
  • There is an increase in the number of transactions on the bitcoin network, causing congestion and delays that are not under BRD's control

articles.name: Why was my purchase order via ACH cancelled?
articles.title: Why was my purchase order via ACH cancelled?
articles.body:
If you are a BRD app user in the US, you can now purchase bitcoin, ether and DAI using your bank accounts.

The process is simple and purchased funds will be available in your wallet in 3-5 business days.

If you are making a purchase order via a US Bank Transfer (ACH), please ensure the following to avoid cancellations:

  • Register with our partner via the app and complete any required verification
  • Check that the bank account you are adding can be used for online purchases (You may need to call your bank to authorize this)
  • Any funds that will be used to make the purchase should be available and cleared in your bank account when you create the purchase order
  • The amount you purchase is within the allowed limits of $2,500 within a 7 day period, and $10,000 monthly

articles.name: How do I contact the BRD Customer Support team via email?
articles.title: How do I contact the BRD Customer Support team via email?
articles.body: If you need additional help or would like to ask questions about the app, you can reach the BRD Customer Support Team via email at Support@BRD.com.

articles.name: What are BRD Rewards?
articles.title: What are BRD Rewards?
articles.body:
The BRD token is the basis for our loyalty and rewards program, BRD Rewards. BRD token holders can enjoy perks based on the number of BRD tokens they hold in the app.

There are two ways to get to the BRD Rewards page:

1.  On the home screen, tap on Menu and then on Rewards; or

2.  Tap on your BRD Token Wallet and then on Rewards

 You will see the following information on the BRD Rewards page:

  • A list of BRD Rewards
  • The required number of BRD tokens needed to be eligible for each reward
  • Which rewards you are currently eligible for (You will see blue icons next to these)

You can find your BRD Rewards ID by tapping About in the app's Menu.

articles.name: How do I buy ether or DAI in the BRD app?
articles.title: How do I buy ether or DAI in the BRD app?
articles.body:
The BRD app provides an easy, convenient, and secure way to buy ether and DAI. Follow these steps to get started:

  1. On the home screen, tap Buy/Sell and select Ethereum or DAI from the list of currencies available for purchase.
  2. Enter the amount you would like to purchase.  You may enter the amount in ETH, DAI or in your local currency.
  3. Select which Payment Method you would like to use and tap Next.
  4. Review the order details and tap Confirm & Buy to proceed with your purchase.
  5. Follow the on-screen instructions on the next page to complete the process.  Keep an eye out for any emails regarding the status of your purchase order.

NOTE: DAI is only available for purchase using US Bank Transfers.

If you have questions about buying in the BRD app, or regarding your order, send us an email at support@brd.com.

articles.name: How do I buy bitcoin in the BRD app?
articles.title: How do I buy bitcoin in the BRD app?
articles.body:
The BRD app provides an easy, convenient, and secure way to buy bitcoin. Follow these steps to get started:

  1. On the home screen, tap Buy/Sell and select Bitcoin from the list of currencies available for purchase.
  2. Enter the amount you would like to purchase.  You may enter the amount in BTC or in your local currency.
  3. Select the Payment Method you would like to use and tap Next.
  4. Review the order details and tap Confirm & Buy to proceed with your purchase.
  5. Follow the on-screen instructions on the next page to complete the process.  Keep an eye out for any emails regarding the status of your purchase order.

If you have questions about buying in the BRD app, or regarding your order, send us an email at support@brd.com.

articles.name: How do I check the KYC status for the SEPA transaction I would like to make in the app?
articles.title: How do I check the KYC status for the SEPA transaction I would like to make in the app?
articles.body:
If you have submitted documents for KYC, you will see a notification in the BRD app's Buy/Sell page to let you know of the status of the review.

If approved, you will also receive instructions on how to complete the order via a SEPA transfer.

articles.name: How do I make a SEPA payment when purchasing funds in the BRD app?
articles.title: How do I make a SEPA payment when purchasing funds in the BRD app?
articles.body:
If you are a resident of the EU, you can use the SEPA payment method to purchase funds with your bank account.

To make a payment using SEPA, follow the steps below:

  1. On the app's main screen, tap on Buy/Sell.
  2. Enter the amount you would like to pay and select the currency you would like to use.  You can also enter the amount of bitcoin you would like to purchase.
  3. Tap Add Payment Method and select Bank Transfer (SEPA).
  4. Click Next.  If you have previously registered with Coinify, tap on Log In at the bottom of the page.
  5. If you are registering for Coinify's service, enter your email address and tap Send email confirmation code. 
  6. Verify your email by entering the code sent to you.
  7. Select your country of residence in the EU. 
  8. You will need to agree to Coinify's Terms of Service to proceed with the next step. Tap the box to agree to Coinify's Terms of Service (ToS) and click Submit.
  9. Tap on Coinify KYC, complete the Registration form and submit the necessary documents. You will receive an email once this has been reviewed.
  10. Once verified, you will receive an email with a Reference Code for your order as well as information on how to send your payment.

Note: To ensure that your SEPA transaction is matched to your order, please write the Reference Code down and make sure you add this in the memo section of your SEPA transfer.

articles.name: Why are some ERC20 tokens no longer supported?
articles.title: Why are some ERC20 tokens no longer supported?
articles.body:
Recently, the developers of some ERC20 tokens have decided to move their tokens to their own blockchain or create a completely new ERC20 token. This would mean the old token needs to be swapped for their new one. Please reach out to the developer of this token to see which situation applies to them. 

If you would like to swap your ERC20 tokens for the new tokens, the first step is to send these tokens to a platform that will support the swap. Each token developer will announce the details of token swaps in their own support channels. 

If the deadline for the token swap has passed and you were unable to swap your ERC20 token for the new tokens, please reach out to the token developer's support team for assistance.

You will see that wallet for these tokens are marked as disabled in your BRD app but they will still be accessible.  If needed, you can find your token address by tapping on the "Receive" button in the wallet.

As long as it is still supported by the Ethereum network, you will be able to send these ERC20 tokens out from the BRD app to another platform that supports the token swap.

articles.name: Why do I get an "Invalid Address" error when sending bitcoin cash?
articles.title: Why do I get an "Invalid Address" error when sending bitcoin cash?
articles.body:
There are 2 address formats used for Bitcoin Cash:

  • The Legacy address which follows the same format as a bitcoin address (these addresses start with 1 or 3); and
  • The "Cash Addr" format which is an encoded version of the legacy address that prevents users from sending bitcoin to a bitcoin cash address and vice versa (these addresses start with bitcoincash:q, q or p).

The BRD app uses the "Cash Addr" format to prevent users from sending bitcoin to a bitcoin cash address and vice versa.  This protects our users from accidental loss of funds.

If you are sending bitcoin cash to a wallet that uses legacy addresses, you can try one of the following:

  1. Contact the third party wallet provider and request for the "Cash Addr" equivalent of the legacy address displayed in the receiving wallet; or
  2. Use a trusted site to convert the legacy address to the "Cash Addr" format.

articles.name: What is SegWit?
articles.title: What is SegWit?
articles.body:
SegWit or Segregated Witness is a soft fork on the Bitcoin Network that aims to solve scalability issues.  By separating the signature (witness) data on transactions, the amount of space needed for each transaction data is reduced, thus allowing more transactions to be stored on each block.

SegWit was activated on the Bitcoin Network on August 23, 2017.

articles.name: What is an ERC20 token?
articles.title: What is an ERC20 token?
articles.body:
ERC20 is a standard or a set of rules for Ethereum based tokens. Tokens that satisfy these set of rules are called ERC20 tokens. These tokens are actually smart contracts on the Ethereum network and have different values.  When sending an ERC20 token to another wallet, you will need to have enough ether in your wallet for the necessary transaction fees.

The amount of time for a block to be confirmed varies depending on the token.  Fees are calculated according to the complexity of the transaction (gas) and paid in ether.

You can switch between currencies from the Home screen, which is accessible by the back arrow found on the top left of any currency screen.

articles.name: What is Ether?
articles.title: What is Ether?
articles.body:
Ether is the currency used on the Ethereum network and was proposed by Vitalik Buterin in 2013.  Ethereum is also a decentralized network and allows smart contracts to be created on its platform so these can be executed without the need for a third party.

Ether was not created to be a digital currency but rather as an incentive or reward for a process to be completed in the Ethereum network. It is referred to as fuel because this is used to pay machines for executing a required process. The Ethereum network allows smart contracts to be created on its platform so these can be executed without the need for a third party.

It takes approximately 15 seconds for a block to be confirmed on the Ethereum network.  Fees are calculated according to the complexity of the transaction (gas) and paid in ether.

You can switch between currencies from the Home screen, which is accessible by the back arrow found on the top left of any currency screen.

articles.name: What is Bitcoin?
articles.title: What is Bitcoin?
articles.body:
Bitcoin was created in 2008 and is the first decentralized digital currency. Together with the creation of bitcoin came the birth of the blockchain - the public ledger that lists all transactions ever made on the bitcoin network. 

New coins called "block rewards" are created when miners solve a complex mathematical problem. Each block contains the transactions that have been validated, as well as information about the previous block. This sequence of events ensures that transactions on the bitcoin network cannot be successfully forged. 

It takes approximately 10 minutes for a block to be confirmed on the Bitcoin network.  Fees are calculated according to the transaction's data size and paid in bitcoin.

You can switch between currencies from the Home screen, which is accessible by the back arrow found on the top left of any currency screen.

articles.name: What is Bitcoin Cash?
articles.title: What is Bitcoin Cash?
articles.body:
Bitcoin cash was born as a result of a hard fork of bitcoin on August 1, 2017 in an effort to solve scalability issues. By increasing block sizes to 8MB, bitcoin cash transactions typically have lower transaction fees than bitcoin. Bitcoin Cash transactions should not be sent to Bitcoin addresses, and vice versa, as they are separate networks.

It takes approximately 10 minutes for a block to be confirmed on the Bitcoin Cash network.  Fees are calculated according to the transaction's data size and paid in bitcoin cash.

NOTE: If you had Bitcoin in your wallet on August 1st, you were automatically credited with the same amount of Bitcoin Cash.

We released a Bitcoin Cash withdrawal feature soon after the fork, allowing users to move their Bitcoin Cash out of their wallet. We now offer full Bitcoin Cash support, and any Bitcoin Cash that was in your wallet from the time of the fork or that was sent to your wallet afterwards will be accessible in your Bitcoin Cash wallet.

You can switch between currencies from the Home screen, which is accessible by the back arrow found on the top left of any currency screen.

articles.name: Why do I need to write down my recovery key?
articles.title: Why do I need to write down my recovery key?
articles.body:
The BRD app connects directly to the cryptocurrency networks, where your wallets are stored. The "keys" to access your wallets are securely stored in your phone and nowhere else. The BRD app will provide you with a unique "Recovery Key," which is a list of 12-words which can be used to recreate the keys to your wallet. If you ever lose or upgrade your phone, this "Recovery Key" is required to regain access to your funds.

Please write down each word, in order, on a piece of paper. We recommend storing your Recovery Key in a safe, safety deposit box at a bank, or wherever you might keep passports, birth certificates, or other important documents. Anyone who has your Recovery Key can access your money, even if they don't have your wallet PIN, so keep it private and don't show it to others!

articles.name: Why do I get an “Insufficient funds” error when sending ether or ERC20 tokens?
articles.title: Why do I get an “Insufficient funds” error when sending ether or ERC20 tokens?
articles.body:
The BRD app does not charge any fees to send a transaction. However, the ethereum network requires a "transaction fee". The cost of this fee varies as the price of the ether changes and the congestion on the network increases.

When sending a transaction, you need to make sure that you have enough funds in your wallet to cover the necessary transaction fee. Otherwise, an “Insufficient funds” error occurs.

If sending ether or ERC20 tokens, fees are not calculated by the amount of money you are sending but rather by the complexity of your transaction.  

ERC20 token transactions require a transaction fee paid in ether.

articles.name: How do I add a token in the BRD app?
articles.title: How do I add a token in the BRD app?
articles.body: With the BRD app, you won't need to go through the complexities of getting the token information to add a token to the app.  Adding a token is as simple as adding a wallet to the app.  Just tap on Add Wallets on the main screen, scroll through the list of tokens and tap on the Add button.

articles.name: Why do I need a PIN?
articles.title: Why do I need a PIN?
articles.body:
The BRD app requires you to set a PIN to secure your wallet, separate from your device passcode. You will be required to enter this PIN to view your balance or send money, which keeps your wallet private even if you let someone use your phone or if your phone is stolen by someone who knows your device passcode.

Do not forget your wallet PIN! It can only be reset by using your Recovery Key. If you forget your PIN and lose your Recovery Key, your wallet will be lost.

articles.name: How do I import a bitcoin paper wallet?
articles.title: How do I import a bitcoin paper wallet?
articles.body:
If you receive a QR code labeled as a "paper wallet" or "private key", you can import it into your BRD app's Bitcoin wallet by following these steps:

  1. On the main screen, tap on Menu.
  2. Under Preferences, tap on Bitcoin Settings.
  3. Select Redeem Private Key.
  4. Tap on Scan Private Key and scan the QR code on your paper wallet.
  5. Any funds stored on the paper wallet/private key will be sent into your BRD app's Bitcoin wallet, and will not remain on the paper wallet/private key.

NOTE:  If you are importing a bitcoin paper wallet created before the August 1, 2017 fork, and would like to get the bitcoin cash credit, follow the steps here.

If you want to import a wallet created with the BRD app, use the Unlink from this device function instead.Visit this page for more information.

articles.name: Why is my ether or ERC20 token transaction missing?
articles.title: Why is my ether or ERC20 token transaction missing?
articles.body:
If one or more transactions are not showing in your wallet, please try force quitting the app and restarting it.  

If you are expecting an incoming transaction into your BRD wallet that hasn’t arrived yet, the 66 digit ether or ERC20 token transaction ID can help the support team track its progress. This ID can usually be found by asking the sender for this information.

articles.name: How does the BRD Ethereum or ERC20 token wallet show my balance in my local currency?
articles.title: How does the BRD Ethereum or ERC20 token wallet show my balance in my local currency?
articles.body:
Money kept in your BRD Ethereum or ERC20 token wallet is always stored as cryptocurrency. The app uses an exchange rate to show you an estimate of how much your ether or ERC20 token is worth in your local currency. When you send a transaction and enter the amount to send in your local currency, the app uses the exchange rate to calculate how much ether or ERC20 token to send.

It's possible people using other wallets are using different exchange rates, so the balance sent/received might be slightly different than what other person sees.

Since the exchange rate is always changing, the amount of money in your wallet as quoted in your local currency may change over time. However, your ether or ERC20 token balance will not change unless you send or receive funds from your wallet.

articles.name: BRD Official Social Media Channels
articles.title: BRD Official Social Media Channels
articles.body:
You can get official updates from the BRD team on the following channels: 

 

Email  support@brd.com

Twitter https://twitter.com/BRDHQ

Facebook https://www.facebook.com/BRDHQ

Reddit https://www.reddit.com/r/brdapp/

Instagram https://www.instagram.com/breadapp/

YouTube https://www.youtube.com/c/Breadbitcoinwallet

Telegram https://t.me/Breadchat

Token mailing list https://token.breadapp.com/en/#contact

General updates mailing list https://breadapp.com/keep-me-updated/

articles.name: How do I reset my PIN with my recovery key?
articles.title: How do I reset my PIN with my recovery key?
articles.body:
Every time you create a new wallet with BRD, you are provided with a "Recovery Key," which is a list of 12 words that can be used to restore access to your wallet if you ever lose or upgrade your phone. You can also use your Recovery Key to reset your wallet PIN if you forget it.

If you have incorrectly entered your PIN several times, you will be able to reset your PIN using your recovery key. Enter the 12 words from your Recovery Key in the correct order, and you will be able to choose a new PIN.

articles.name: How do I exchange a supported currency to ether or to an ERC20 token?
articles.title: How do I exchange a supported currency to ether or to an ERC20 token?
articles.body:
With the BRD app, you can exchange any supported currency to ether or to a supported ERC20 token by following the steps below:

  1. Tap on Trade at the bottom of the main page.
  2. On the next page, select the currency you want to trade for ether or ERC20 tokens.
  3. Select ETH or the ERC20 token you want to receive.
  4. Enter the amount you want to trade in the Pay With section. You will see how much ether or ERC20 tokens you will receive below that.
  5. Tap Next to confirm your purchase.

Exchanging currencies may take up to 6 hours to complete.

articles.name: Why is syncing to the Bitcoin Cash blockchain taking too long or not successful?
articles.title: Why is syncing to the Bitcoin Cash blockchain taking too long or not successful?
articles.body:
When syncing takes too long or does not complete, try the following steps to correct the issue:

  • Force close the app and try again;
  • If you are using mobile data, switch to wifi and vice versa;
  • Move to a different location in your house or office to get a better signal;
  • Try again using a different internet connection in a different location

Syncing takes 30 minutes or more and your phone’s screen must remain on the BRD app to ensure syncing completes. 

Visit this page if you need instructions on how to sync your Bitcoin Cash wallet to the blockchain.

articles.name: When should I sync my Bitcoin Cash wallet to the blockchain?
articles.title: When should I sync my Bitcoin Cash wallet to the blockchain?
articles.body:
Your BRD wallet connects directly to the Bitcoin Cash network. This improves security and privacy, but also means sometimes your wallet can get out of sync with the network.

Syncing with the blockchain can take a lot of time, and usually isn't necessary. If someone sent you bitcoin cash and the transaction is confirmed on the blockchain, but it is not appearing in your wallet, your wallet may be out of sync. First check to make sure the address the bitcoin cash was sent to is correct.

If you are trying to send bitcoin cash and constantly get an error message that your transaction was rejected, it could also mean your wallet is out of sync.

In either of these cases, using this feature will rescan the blockchain to find your bitcoin cash and display it properly in your wallet. Visit this page for instructions on how to sync your wallet to the blockchain.

articles.name: How do I get started?
articles.title: How do I get started?
articles.body:
Welcome to BRD!

The BRD app connects directly to the cryptocurrency networks it supports. There are no accounts or usernames with the BRD app. Instead, you will have a "wallet" where you will store your money. It's just like the physical wallet you put your cash in, except that it exists only on the internet and holds digital money.

Follow these steps to get started:

  1. If this is your first time using the BRD app, simply choose Get Started to start.
  2. Tap Next twice.
  3. If you would like to start by making a purchase, select Buy some coin. Otherwise, tap I'll browse first.
  4. Create a 6 digit PIN and confirm this on the next page.
  5. Tap Continue on the next three pages.  Make sure you read the important information on each page about the recovery key.
  6. Tap Generate Recovery Key.
  7. The app shows you 12 different words in separate pages. This is your Recovery Key. Swipe left after writing down each word. If you need to review these, swipe back. Tap Done. 

    IMPORTANT: Make sure that you write the Recovery Key down in the correct order and keep it secure as this is the only way to restore your BRD wallet.

    For more information about the Recovery Key, visit this page.

  8. The app will ask you to confirm random words from your Recovery Key. Tap Confirm after entering the requested words.

  9. Tap Go to Wallet. The wallets sync to the blockchain.  Keep the app open and on the screen until syncing completes.

  10. You will see a box asking you to enable Touch ID. This is optional. Tap on Dismiss if you would like to skip this step. You can enable this later via the app’s Security Center. Visit this page for more information on Touch ID.

NOTE: If you have used the BRD app before and would like to use the same wallet, choose Restore Wallet on the main page and prepare to enter the Recovery Key for the wallet you would like to restore.

Visit this page for help on recovering a wallet.

articles.name: How do I confirm my recovery key?
articles.title: How do I confirm my recovery key?
articles.body: It is very important that your Recovery Key is written down correctly, and in the correct order. Enter the words requested to make sure everything is correct. For example, "Word #1" means the first word of your Recovery Key, "Word #2" means the second word, etc.

articles.name: How do I exchange my ether or ERC20 token to another supported currency?
articles.title: How do I exchange my ether or ERC20 token to another supported currency?
articles.body:
With the BRD app, you can exchange your ether or ERC20 token to another supported currency by following the steps below:

  1. Tap on Trade at the bottom of the main page.
  2. On the next page, select ETH or the ERC20 token you want to trade.
  3. Select the currency you want to trade your ether or ERC20 token for.
  4. Enter the amount of ether or ERC20 tokens you want to trade in the Pay With section. You will see how much of the other currency or token you will receive below that.
  5. Tap Next to confirm your purchase.

Exchanging currencies may take up to 6 hours to complete. 

ERC20 token transactions require a transaction fee paid in ether.

articles.name: How do I sync my BRD app's Bitcoin Cash wallet to the blockchain?
articles.title: How do I sync my BRD app's Bitcoin Cash wallet to the blockchain?
articles.body:
Although not usually necessary, sometimes you may need to sync your BRD bitcoin cash wallet to the blockchain. Syncing to the blockchain ensures that you see the most up to date information regarding the transactions in your wallet.

Follow these steps to sync your wallet:

  1. On the main screen, tap Menu.
  2. Under Preferences choose Bitcoin Cash Settings.
  3. Select Sync Blockchain.
  4. Tap on Start Sync.
  5. In the pop-up window, tap Sync to begin

NOTE: You will not be able to make a transaction until the sync completes.

If the sync button is greyed out, that means a sync is already in progress.  To make sure that the sync completes, use a stable internet connection and keep the app open with screen on until the status bar disappears. Syncing can take 30 minutes or more to complete.

articles.name: Why do I get an “Insufficient funds” error when sending bitcoin cash?
articles.title: Why do I get an “Insufficient funds” error when sending bitcoin cash?
articles.body:
The BRD app does not charge any fees to send a transaction. However, the bitcoin cash network requires a "transaction fee". The cost of this fee varies as the price of the bitcoin cash changes and the congestion on the network increases.

When sending a transaction, you need to make sure that you have enough funds in your wallet to cover the necessary transaction fee. Otherwise, an “Insufficient funds” error occurs.

When sending bitcoin cash, fees are not calculated by the amount of money you are sending but rather by the amount of data attached to your transaction. On top of the amount being sent, this data will include information about where the funds came from and where it is being sent to.

If you are sending funds that came from several smaller transactions sent to your wallet, all of the information from those smaller transactions need to be referenced in the new transaction. This increases the data size of the new transaction and may cause the fee to be multiplied several times depending on how large the data size is. Sending a smaller transaction may help in this case. Also, if you receive small transactions regularly, you may want to arrange for larger and less frequent payments instead.

articles.name: Is the BRD app free?
articles.title: Is the BRD app free?
articles.body: Our core product is and always will be 100% free and open source. Additional, opt-in features such as the ability to buy, sell or trade cryptocurrency may be offered through the app for a fee.

articles.name: Will I be charged cash advance fees if I buy ether with a card?
articles.title: Will I be charged cash advance fees if I buy ether with a card?
articles.body:
The BRD app supports credit and debit card purchases. 

Card purchases are processed as regular credit card transactions.  However, some banks might charge cash advanced fees.  This is not charged by the BRD app.

Please reach out to your card issuer to check if cash advanced fees will be applied to purchases under Merchant Category Code (MCC) - 6051.

articles.name: Why is my bitcoin cash transaction missing?
articles.title: Why is my bitcoin cash transaction missing?
articles.body:
Your BRD Bitcoin Cash wallet needs to be in sync with the blockchain to show your transactions. If one or more transactions are not showing in your wallet, please try syncing to resolve the issue. For instructions on how to sync your wallet, please visit this page.

If you are expecting an incoming transaction into your BRD wallet that hasn’t arrived yet, the 64 digit bitcoin cash transaction ID can help the support team track its progress. This ID can usually be found by asking the sender for this information.

articles.name: How does the BRD Bitcoin Cash wallet show my balance in my local currency?
articles.title: How does the BRD Bitcoin Cash wallet show my balance in my local currency?
articles.body:
Money kept in your BRD Bitcoin Cash wallet is always stored as bitcoin cash. The app uses an exchange rate to show you an estimate of how much your bitcoin cash is worth in your local currency. When you send a transaction and enter the amount to send in your local currency, the app uses the exchange rate to calculate how much bitcoin cash to send.

It's possible people using other wallets are using different exchange rates, so the balance sent/received might be slightly different than what other person sees.

Since the exchange rate is always changing, the amount of money in your wallet as quoted in your local currency may change over time. However, your bitcoin cash balance will not change unless you send or receive funds from your wallet.

articles.name: What is a recovery key?
articles.title: What is a recovery key?
articles.body:
A recovery key consists of 12 randomly generated words. The app creates the recovery key for you automatically when you start a new wallet.

The recovery key is critically important and should be written down and stored in a safe location. Never take screenshots of your recovery key as this can be stolen if someone gains access to your device.

In the event of phone theft, destruction, or loss, the recovery key can be used to recover your wallet onto a new phone. The key is also required when upgrading your current phone to a new one.

To find your recovery key follow these steps:

  1. On the main screen, tap on Menu.
  2. Select Security Settings.
  3. Tap on Recovery Key.
  4. Tap on Write Down Recovery Key Again.
  5. Enter your PIN and you will be shown each word in your recovery key on separate pages.

articles.name: How do I use the "Request an Amount" screen in my Ethereum or ERC20 token wallet?
articles.title: How do I use the "Request an Amount" screen in my Ethereum or ERC20 token wallet?
articles.body:
The QR code you use to receive money in your BRD Ethereum or ERC20 token wallet can contain only your ethereum address, or it can also specify the amount of money that you wish to receive. If you use the Request an Amount feature, the amount of money you enter will be included in the QR code.

When someone scans your QR code, the amount to send will automatically be filled out, so the sender doesn’t have to enter it themselves. This makes it easier to specify how much ether or ERC20 tokens should be sent, and prevent mistakes when trying to receive a specific amount.

articles.name: What are the fees for buying or selling ether or DAI through the BRD app?
articles.title: What are the fees for buying or selling ether or DAI through the BRD app?
articles.body: Fees, when purchasing or selling ether or DAI through the BRD app, will be displayed in the order summary after choosing Buy/Sell from the BRD app's main screen.

articles.name: Why is syncing to the Bitcoin blockchain taking too long or not successful?
articles.title: Why is syncing to the Bitcoin blockchain taking too long or not successful?
articles.body:
When syncing takes too long or does not complete, try the following steps to correct the issue:

  • Force close the app and try again;
  • If you are using mobile data, switch to wifi and vice versa;
  • Move to a different location in your house or office to get a better signal;
  • Try again using a different internet connection in a different location

Syncing takes 30 minutes or more and your phone’s screen must remain on the BRD app to ensure syncing completes. 

Visit this page if you need instructions on how to sync your Bitcoin wallet to the blockchain.

articles.name: How do I sync my BRD app's Bitcoin wallet to the blockchain?
articles.title: How do I sync my BRD app's Bitcoin wallet to the blockchain?
articles.body:
Although not usually necessary, sometimes you may need to sync your BRD bitcoin wallet to the blockchain. Syncing to the blockchain ensures that you see the most up to date information regarding the transactions in your wallet.

Follow these steps to sync your wallet:

  1. On the main screen, tap Menu.
  2. Under Preferences choose Bitcoin Settings.
  3. Select Sync Blockchain.
  4. Tap on Start Sync.
  5. In the pop-up window, tap Sync to begin

NOTE: You will not be able to make a transaction until the sync completes.

If the sync button is greyed out, that means a sync is already in progress.  To make sure that the sync completes, use a stable internet connection and keep the app open with screen on until the status bar disappears. Syncing can take 30 minutes or more to complete.

If you are an advanced user and would like to connect to a specific node for syncing, please visit this page for instructions.

articles.name: What is fingerprint authentication?
articles.title: What is fingerprint authentication?
articles.body:
Touch ID on iPhone

Touch ID is available on any iPhone 5s or later, iPad Pro, iPad Air 2, or iPad mini 3 or later. If you have it enabled on your device, you can use your fingerprint to unlock your BRD wallet and authorize transactions instead of entering your passcode. You will still be required to enter your passcode periodically for increased security.

If Touch ID is not enabled on your device, you can enable it in your device's settings under "Touch ID & Passcode". 

Fingerprint Authorization on Android

Many Android devices feature a fingerprint reader. You can use your fingerprint to unlock your BRD wallet and authorize transactions instead of entering your passcode. You will still be required to enter your passcode periodically for increased security.

In order to use this feature in the BRD app, fingerprint authorization must be enabled on your device. See the phone manufacturer's manual for more information.

articles.name: How do I exchange a supported currency to bitcoin cash?
articles.title: How do I exchange a supported currency to bitcoin cash?
articles.body:
With the BRD app, you can exchange any supported currency to bitcoin cash by following the steps below:

  1. Tap on Trade at the bottom of the main page.
  2. On the next page, select the currency you want to trade for bitcoin cash.
  3. Select BCH on the following page.
  4. Enter the amount you want to trade in the Pay With section. You will see how much bitcoin cash you will receive below that.
  5. Tap Next to confirm your purchase.

Exchanging currencies may take up to 6 hours to complete.

articles.name: Why is the value of ether or ERC20 token sent different than the value received?
articles.title: Why is the value of ether or ERC20 token sent different than the value received?
articles.body: Money in your BRD app's Ethereum or ERC20 token wallet is always held as cryptocurrency, and the value in your local currency is displayed as an estimate only. The exchange rate used to make this estimate is always fluctuating, and depending on when a transaction is sent or received the estimated value of the transaction can change. It is common for the estimated value of a transaction to be seen differently by the sender and receiver, however the amount of ether sent should not change.

articles.name: Why is my bitcoin transaction missing?
articles.title: Why is my bitcoin transaction missing?
articles.body:
Your BRD Bitcoin wallet needs to be in sync with the blockchain to show your transactions. If one or more transactions are not showing in your wallet, please try syncing to resolve the issue. For instructions on how to sync your wallet, please visit this page.

If you are expecting an incoming transaction into your BRD wallet that hasn’t arrived yet, the 64 digit bitcoin transaction ID can help the support team track its progress. This ID can usually be found by asking the sender for this information.

articles.name: How do I connect to a specific bitcoin node?
articles.title: How do I connect to a specific bitcoin node?
articles.body:
The BRD app connects to a random node on the bitcoin network when syncing your wallet. You can choose to connect to a specific node of your preference by following the steps below:

  1. On the main screen, tap on Menu.
  2. Select Preferences and then Bitcoin Settings.
  3. Choose Bitcoin Nodes
  4. Tap Switch to Manual Mode
  5. Enter the Node IP address in the window that pops up.  You may also enter a port, although this is optional.  Tap OK when done.

Your wallet will now sync to the blockchain via your preferred node.

articles.name: How do I exchange my bitcoin cash to another supported currency?
articles.title: How do I exchange my bitcoin cash to another supported currency?
articles.body:
With the BRD app, you can exchange your bitcoin cash to another supported currency by following the steps below:

  1. Tap on Trade at the bottom of the main page.
  2. On the next page, select BCH.
  3. Select the currency you want to trade your bitcoin cash for.
  4. Enter the amount of bitcoin cash you want to trade in the Pay With section. You will see how much of the other currency or token you will receive below that.
  5. Tap Next to confirm your purchase.

Exchanging currencies may take up to 6 hours to complete.

articles.name: What are the ethereum or ERC20 token transaction details?
articles.title: What are the ethereum or ERC20 token transaction details?
articles.body:
This screen shows details about the transaction:

Status

When sending with BRD, the recipient will usually receive the transaction in 1-5 minutes. For receiving, we have no control over how long it will take for the transaction to complete

If the transaction status is "complete," then the transaction has successfully gone through. If this is a transaction you sent, the money is now in the wallet of the recipient. If this is a transaction you received, the money is now in your wallet, ready to be spent.

If the status is not yet complete, this will show the current progress. 

Memo

Here you can attach a note to the transaction to remind yourself what it was for. This memo will not be shared with anyone else and is only visible to you, but you can edit it at any time, even after the transaction has completed. 

Amount

This shows detailed information about how much ether or ERC20 tokens were sent, how much it was worth at the time, and other details about your balance.

Other

At the bottom of this screen you will find additional technical details about the transaction. The ethereum or ERC20 token transaction ID can be used as proof that a payment was made.

articles.name: Why do I get an “Insufficient funds” error when sending bitcoin?
articles.title: Why do I get an “Insufficient funds” error when sending bitcoin?
articles.body:
The BRD app does not charge any fees to send a transaction. However, the bitcoin network requires a "transaction fee". The cost of this fee varies as the price of the bitcoin changes and the congestion on the network increases.

When sending a transaction, you need to make sure that you have enough funds in your wallet to cover the necessary transaction fee. Otherwise, an “Insufficient funds” error occurs.

When sending bitcoin, fees are not calculated by the amount of money you are sending but rather by the amount of data attached to your transaction. On top of the amount being sent, this data will include information about where the funds came from and where it is being sent to.

If you are sending funds that came from several smaller transactions sent to your wallet, all of the information from those smaller transactions need to be referenced in the new transaction. This increases the data size of the new transaction and may cause the fee to be multiplied several times depending on how large the data size is. Sending a smaller transaction may help in this case. Also, if you receive small transactions regularly, you may want to arrange for larger and less frequent payments instead.

articles.name: When should I sync my Bitcoin wallet to the blockchain?
articles.title: When should I sync my Bitcoin wallet to the blockchain?
articles.body:
Your BRD wallet connects directly to the Bitcoin network. This improves security and privacy, but also means sometimes your wallet can get out of sync with the network.

Syncing with the blockchain can take a lot of time, and usually isn't necessary. If someone sent you bitcoin and the transaction is confirmed on the blockchain, but it is not appearing in your wallet, your wallet may be out of sync. First check to make sure the address the bitcoin was sent to is correct.

If you are trying to send bitcoin and constantly get an error message that your transaction was rejected, it could also mean your wallet is out of sync.

In either of these cases, using this feature will rescan the blockchain to find your bitcoins and display it properly in your wallet. Visit this page for instructions on how to sync your wallet to the blockchain.

articles.name: Why can't I see my funds after recovering my wallet?
articles.title: Why can't I see my funds after recovering my wallet?
articles.body:
You can recover your wallets by using the 12 word recovery key shown to you when you first created your wallet.

If your wallets do not show the correct balance after recovery, the following steps can help fix the issue:

  1. Force quit the app and launch this again.  If you see that the app is syncing after restarting, leave the app open until this completes.
  2. Sync the Bitcoin and/or Bitcoin Cash wallets.  Syncing after recovering a wallet may take a little longer than usual so be prepared to leave your app open and on the screen until syncing completes.  Visit these pages if you need help with syncing the Bitcoin or Bitcoin Cash wallets.
  3. Check that you used the correct 12 word recovery key to recover your wallets.  If you have wiped or reinstalled your wallet in the past, you may have created more than one set of wallets.  Each of these wallets will have their own set of recovery keys.

articles.name: How does the BRD Bitcoin wallet show my balance in my local currency?
articles.title: How does the BRD Bitcoin wallet show my balance in my local currency?
articles.body:
Money kept in your BRD Bitcoin wallet is always stored as bitcoin. The app uses an exchange rate to show you an estimate of how much your bitcoin is worth in your local currency. When you send a transaction and enter the amount to send in your local currency, the app uses the exchange rate to calculate how much bitcoin to send.

It's possible people using other wallets are using different exchange rates, so the balance sent/received might be slight different than what other person sees.

Since the exchange rate is always changing, the amount of money in your wallet as quoted in your local currency may change over time. However, your bitcoin balance will not change unless you send or receive bitcoin.

articles.name: How do I add or remove wallets in the BRD app?
articles.title: How do I add or remove wallets in the BRD app?
articles.body:
You may customize the BRD app to only show wallets for any supported currency that you own.  

Adding a new ERC20 token wallet

  1. On the main screen, tap Add Wallets.
  2. Scroll through the list or use the search field to locate the currency you want to add.
  3. Tap on the Add button to the right of the currency.

 

Hiding an ERC20 token wallet

  1. On the main screen, tap Menu.
  2. Select Manage Wallets and locate the wallet you want to remove from the list.
  3. Tap on the Hide button to the right of the currency.

 

If you want to show or hide the Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash, Ethereum, BRD Token or any ERC20 token wallets you have previously added, tap on Manage Wallets and tap the Show or Hide buttons.

You can also go to Preferences and tap on Reset to Default Currencies if you would like to only show the default wallets. This action updates the main screen so it displays the default wallets and hides any other wallets you may have added.  This action does not wipe any funds from the wallets.

articles.name: How can I send ether or ERC20 tokens from BRD?
articles.title: How can I send ether or ERC20 tokens from BRD?
articles.body:
In your BRD app, a wallet is created for the supported cryptocurrencies you own.  Follow these steps to send ether or ERC20 tokens from your wallet:

  1. On the main screen, tap Ethereum or the wallet for the ERC20 token you want to send.
  2. Tap Send at the bottom.
  3. Enter the amount you would like to send.  For your convenience, you can toggle the amount to cryptocurrency or your local currency.
  4. Tap Next.
  5. Enter the ether or ERC20 token address you are sending funds to.  There are several ways to do this:
    • Tap on Scan and scan the QR code from the receiving wallet.
    • Copy the receiving wallet’s address and paste it in the To field.
    • Manually type the recipient’s address and double checking to make sure that it is accurate.  Addresses are case sensitive.
  6. Add a memo.  This is optional.  Memos are only visible to you and is not sent to the receiving party.
  7. Tap Send, verify that the transaction details are correct, and confirm the payment with your PIN or fingerprint.

 

Important: If ether or ERC20 tokens are sent to the wrong address, it can not be refunded. When sending ether or ERC20 tokens, always check to make sure the address you are sending to is the same as the one that was given to you (comparing the first 5 or 6 digits is usually sufficient to make sure you are using the correct address). 

ERC20 token transactions require a transaction fee paid in ether.

articles.name: Why do I get a “No internet connection found” error?
articles.title: Why do I get a “No internet connection found” error?
articles.body:
Your BRD wallet needs to be connected to the internet to send and receive funds as well as to sync to the blockchain. A “No internet connection found” error means your phone does not have a stable connection to the internet, or your network connection is blocking access to the cryptocurrency networks.

The best way to solve this is to connect to a strong and stable internet connection. Try the following if you encounter this error:

  • Force close the app and try again;
  • If you are using mobile data, switch to wifi and vice versa;
  • Move to a different location in your house or office to get a better signal;
  • Try again using a different internet connection in a different location.

articles.name: How do I exchange a supported currency to bitcoin?
articles.title: How do I exchange a supported currency to bitcoin?
articles.body:
With the BRD app, you can exchange any supported currency to bitcoin by following the steps below:

  1. Tap on Trade at the bottom of the main page.
  2. On the next page, select the currency you want to trade for bitcoin.
  3. Select BTC on the following page.
  4. Enter the amount you want to trade in the Pay With section. You will see how much bitcoin you will receive below that.
  5. Tap Next to confirm your purchase.

Exchanging currencies may take up to 6 hours to complete.

articles.name: Why does it cost money to send an ether or ERC20 token transaction?
articles.title: Why does it cost money to send an ether or ERC20 token transaction?
articles.body:
BRD does not charge any fees to send a transaction. However, the ethereum network does require a fee, called a "transaction fee". This fee is calculated based on the complexity of the transaction, and is always displayed to you before you authorize a payment to be sent. 

ERC20 token transactions require a fee paid in ether.

articles.name: How do I update my PIN?
articles.title: How do I update my PIN?
articles.body:
Your BRD app PIN helps keep your wallet secure and is needed to send transactions out of your wallet. For the best security, we recommend you create a PIN that is different from your device PIN.

If you believe your PIN may have been compromised or just wish to change this to a new one, you can update this by following these steps:

  1. After logging in to the BRD app, tap on Menu. 
  2. Select Security Settings.
  3. Choose Update PIN.
  4. Enter your current PIN
  5. Enter the new PIN and confirm this on the next page.

Your PIN can only be reset by using your Recovery Key. 

Click here to see how you can reset your PIN using your Recovery Key.

articles.name: How do I access an unsupported cryptocurrency I sent to my BRD wallet?
articles.title: How do I access an unsupported cryptocurrency I sent to my BRD wallet?
articles.body:
The BRD app only supports bitcoin, bitcoin cash, ethereum and some ERC20 tokens at the moment. Unsupported currencies sent to your BRD wallet will be inaccessible and we will not be able to return those funds to you.

To prevent loss of funds, do not send any unsupported cryptocurrency to your BRD wallet.

Your recovery key follows the BIP39 standard, and may be compatible with other BIP39 services or tools. We are unable to support sharing your recovery key with other services as this is an advanced operation.

articles.name: How do I exchange my bitcoin to another supported currency?
articles.title: How do I exchange my bitcoin to another supported currency?
articles.body:
With the BRD app, you can exchange your bitcoin to another supported currency by following the steps below:

  1. Tap on Trade at the bottom of the main page.
  2. On the next page, select BTC.
  3. Select the currency you want to trade your bitcoin for.
  4. Enter the amount of bitcoin you want to trade in the Pay With section. You will see how much of the other currency or token you will receive below that.
  5. Tap Next to confirm your purchase.

Exchanging currencies may take up to 6 hours to complete.

articles.name: How do I receive ether or ERC20 tokens in my BRD wallet?
articles.title: How do I receive ether or ERC20 tokens in my BRD wallet?
articles.body:
If you would like to receive ether or any supported ERC20 token from someone, you will need to give them your receiving address. Follow these steps to find your receiving address:

  1. On the main screen, tap Ethereum or the ERC20 token you want to receive.
  2. At the bottom of the screen, tap Receive.
  3. Give the sending party your receiving address. There are a few ways to do this:
  • Show them the Receive Money screen in your wallet, and let them scan your QR code.
  • Press the Share button under the QR code to send them your address via email or text message.
  • Tap the QR code to copy your address to your device's memory. You can now paste your address into a website or other app.

You can also request for a specific amount by using the Request an Amount option.  Visit this page for information on how to use this.


IMPORTANT: If ether or ERC20 tokens are sent to the wrong address, it can not be refunded. When sending or receiving funds, always check to make sure the address being sent funds to is the same as the one that was given (comparing the first 5 or 6 digits is usually sufficient to make sure you are using the correct address).

articles.name: How do I change the local currency displayed in my wallet?
articles.title: How do I change the local currency displayed in my wallet?
articles.body:
Your BRD wallet will show your cryptocurrency and its equivalent fiat value in your local currency by default. 

You can change this to show the value in a different local currency by following these steps:

  1. On the main screen, tap Menu.
  2. Select Preferences and then Display Currency.
  3. Choose the currency you would like to use from the list.

articles.name: The BRD app couldn't be authenticated on Android.
articles.title: The BRD app couldn't be authenticated on Android.
articles.body:
The BRD app uses the hardware encryption of Android phones to secure each user's funds. In order to access this system, it requires the user to enter their device passcode or provide a fingerprint. 

A bug in some versions of Android can cause this authentication to not work, in which case the BRD app can not access the user's wallet. This issue has been fixed in Android version 8 and above.

If you are experiencing this problem, update to Android 8 or higher. If your phone is unable to use Android 8, you can try the following, however there are some risks:

  1. Make sure your recovery key is written down.
  2. In the Android settings, remove all fingerprints and device authentication by setting the screen lock setting to "none". This will erase all data protected by the hardware encryption, including your BRD wallet data. Other apps may be affected as well, so proceed with caution.
  3. Re-enable lock screen authentication and re-register your fingerprints for fingerprint authentication.
  4. Open the BRD app and restore your wallet with the recovery key.

This solution might not work on all phones. We suggest users update to Android 8 as soon as possible.

articles.name: How do I use the "Request an Amount" screen in my Bitcoin Cash wallet?
articles.title: How do I use the "Request an Amount" screen in my Bitcoin Cash wallet?
articles.body:
The QR code you use to receive money in your BRD Bitcoin Cash wallet can contain only your bitcoin cash address, or it can also specify the amount of money that you wish to receive. If you use the Request an Amount feature, the amount of money you enter will be included in the QR code.

When someone scans your QR code, the amount to send will automatically be filled out, so the sender doesn’t have to enter it themselves. This makes it easier to specify how much bitcoin cash should be sent, and prevent mistakes when trying to receive a specific amount of bitcoin cash.

NOTE: The BRD wallet uses the "CashAddr" format for BCH addresses to protect customers from loss of funds. This is a new format that encodes your bitcoin cash address so you do not accidentally send bitcoin to a bitcoin cash address and vice versa.  If the wallet being used to send bitcoin cash does not support this format yet, use an online resource to convert the CashAddr to a legacy address.

articles.name: Will I be charged cash advance fees if I buy bitcoin with a card?
articles.title: Will I be charged cash advance fees if I buy bitcoin with a card?
articles.body:
The BRD app supports credit and debit card purchases. 

Card purchases are processed as regular credit card transactions.  However, some banks might charge cash advanced fees.  This is not charged by the BRD app.

Please reach out to your card issuer to check if cash advanced fees will be applied to purchases under Merchant Category Code (MCC) - 6051.

articles.name: How do I recover a previous wallet I had with BRD?
articles.title: How do I recover a previous wallet I had with BRD?
articles.body:
When you launch the BRD app for the first time, you will be given the option to create a new wallet or to recover a wallet. If you have a 12 word recovery key from a previous BRD wallet that you would like to recover, follow these steps to recover your wallet:

  1. Select Restore Wallet.
  2. Click Next and enter the 12 word Recovery Key in the correct order for the wallet you want to recover.
  3. Set a PIN.
  4. Confirm the PIN.
  5. Leave the app open and on the screen to allow the wallets to sync to the blockchain.

Initial syncing can take up to 45 minutes or more so please prepare to leave the app open with the screen on for an extended period of time.

If you wish to recover a wallet using a recovery key but you already have an active wallet loaded in the BRD app, you will need to follow the directions to wipe the wallet before beginning the process above. If the wallet you are wiping has funds, be sure to write down the 12 word recovery key for the existing wallet (which can be found in the Security Center) before loading the recovery key for the wallet you wish to recover. Visit this page for help on wiping a wallet.

articles.name: Why is my wallet disabled?
articles.title: Why is my wallet disabled?
articles.body:
If you enter an incorrect wallet PIN too many times, your wallet will become disabled for a certain amount of time. This is to prevent someone else from trying to guess your PIN by quickly making many guesses. If your wallet is disabled, wait until the time shown and you will be able to enter your PIN again.

If you continue to enter the incorrect PIN, the amount of time you will have to wait in between attempts will increase. Eventually, the app will reset and you can start a new wallet.

If you have the recovery key for your wallet, you can use it to reset your PIN by choosing the appropriate option on the lock screen.

articles.name: Why did my bitcoin cash Receive Address change?
articles.title: Why did my bitcoin cash Receive Address change?
articles.body: Whenever you receive a payment to the bitcoin cash address shown, a new address is automatically generated for you. By using a unique address for every transaction, you can increase privacy and security. Old addresses will still continue to work, even if they are no longer displayed in your app.

articles.name: How do I wipe my wallet?
articles.title: How do I wipe my wallet?
articles.body:
The BRD app can only have one wallet active at a time. If you choose to start a new wallet or recover an existing wallet, the currently active wallet must be erased first.

IMPORTANT: If you erase your wallet without writing down its Recovery Key, your money will be lost. To prevent this, you must first enter your Recovery Key for the currently active wallet to make sure you have it written down correctly. Visit this page for help on finding your Recovery Key.

Follow these steps to wipe a wallet:

  1. Tap on Menu in the main screen.
  2. Select Security Settings.
  3. Tap on Unlink from this device and then on Next.
  4. Enter the current wallet’s Recovery Key.
  5. Tap on Wipe.

The wallet will then be erased, and you can create a new wallet or recover a previous wallet.

articles.name: What are the fees for buying or selling bitcoin through the BRD app?
articles.title: What are the fees for buying or selling bitcoin through the BRD app?
articles.body:
Fees, when purchasing or selling bitcoin through the BRD app, are different depending on the payment method used. Fees will be displayed under each payment method after choosing Buy/Sell at the bottom of the BRD app's home screen.

When using a bitcoin ATM, fees can vary based on location and are often set by the local operator. Please see the ATM itself for details.

articles.name: Why is the value of bitcoin cash sent different than the value received?
articles.title: Why is the value of bitcoin cash sent different than the value received?
articles.body: Money in your BRD Bitcoin Cash wallet is always held as bitcoin cash, and the value in your local currency is displayed as an estimate only. The exchange rate used to make this estimate is always fluctuating, and depending on when a transaction is sent or received the estimated value of the transaction can change. It is common for the estimated value of a transaction to be seen differently by the sender and receiver, however the amount of bitcoin cash sent should not change.

articles.name: What are the bitcoin cash transaction details?
articles.title: What are the bitcoin cash transaction details?
articles.body:
This screen shows details about the transaction:

Status

When sending with BRD, the recipient will usually receive the transaction in 10-60 minutes. For receiving, we have no control over how long it will take for the transaction to complete.

If the transaction status is "complete," then the transaction has successfully gone through. If this is a transaction you sent, the money is now in the wallet of the recipient. If this is a transaction you received, the money is now in your wallet, ready to be spent.

If the status is not yet complete, this will show the current progress. 

Memo

Here you can attach a note to the transaction to remind yourself what it was for. This memo will not be shared with anyone else and is only visible to you, but you can edit it at any time, even after the transaction has completed.

Amount

This shows detailed information about how much bitcoin cash was sent, how much it was worth at the time, and other details about your balance.

Other

At the bottom of this screen you will find additional technical details about the transaction. The bitcoin cash transaction ID can be used as proof that a payment was made.

articles.name: How long will it take for a bitcoin cash transaction to arrive in my BRD wallet?
articles.title: How long will it take for a bitcoin cash transaction to arrive in my BRD wallet?
articles.body:
Bitcoin cash transactions are processed by the bitcoin cash network in order to become confirmed. Transactions which pay a higher network fee get processed faster, and if your transaction is taking a long time to confirm it could mean the sender included a network fee that was too low.

Occasionally, even transactions that have paid an adequate fee can still take extra time to be processed by the network. We have no control over this process, and the only option is to wait for the network to process your transaction.

Your transaction will be marked "Pending" until it has received 6 confirmations on the network. Once the necessary confirmations have been received, the transaction will be marked "Complete".

The process of confirming transactions happens outside of your the BRD app and is not within our control.

If a transaction does not appear in your wallet, this may be due to one or more of the following reasons:

  • Your wallet needs to be synced to the blockchain. Click here to learn more about syncing your wallet.
  • Your incoming transaction has been dropped from the network. This can happen when the transaction remains unconfirmed for several weeks. When a transaction is dropped from the network, the funds are returned to the sender’s address. Ensuring that an adequate network transaction fee is attached to your transaction can help prevent this.
  • The funds you are expecting to receive in your BRD wallet have been mistakenly sent to the wrong address. Bitcoin cash transactions are irreversible so always make sure that the person sending you funds is using the correct address.

articles.name: Why does it cost money to send a bitcoin cash transaction?
articles.title: Why does it cost money to send a bitcoin cash transaction?
articles.body:
The BRD wallet does not charge any fees to send a transaction. However, the bitcoin cash network requires a fee, called a "transaction fee". This fee is calculated based on the complexity of the transaction, and is always displayed to you before you authorize a payment to be sent.

Bitcoin Cash wallets that receive many small payments before trying to send one large transaction may be charged a higher transaction fee. If possible, combining the payments you receive into a smaller number of larger transactions can keep your transaction fees low.

articles.name: How can I send bitcoin cash from BRD?
articles.title: How can I send bitcoin cash from BRD?
articles.body:
In your BRD app, a wallet is created for the supported cryptocurrencies you own.  Follow these steps to send bitcoin cash from your wallet:

  1. On the home screen, tap Bitcoin Cash.
  2. Tap Send at the bottom.
  3. Enter the BCH address you are sending funds to.  There are several ways to do this:
    • Tap on Scan and scan the QR code from the receiving wallet.
    • Copy the receiving wallet’s address and paste it in the To field.
    • Manually type the recipient’s address and double checking to make sure that it is accurate.  Addresses are case sensitive.
  4. Enter the amount you would like to send.  For your convenience, you can toggle the amount to BCH or your local currency.
  5. Add a memo.  This is optional. Memos are only visible to you and is not sent to the receiving party.
  6. Tap Send, verify that the transaction details are correct, and confirm the payment with your PIN or fingerprint.

NOTE:  The BRD app uses the "CashAddr" format for bitcoin cash addresses.  This is a new format that encodes your bitcoin cash address so you do not accidentally send bitcoin to a bitcoin cash address and vice versa. The BRD bitcoin cash wallet uses this format to protect our customers from loss of funds.

Important: If bitcoin cash is sent to the wrong address, it can not be refunded. When sending bitcoin cash, always check to make sure the address you are sending to is the same as the one that was given to you (comparing the first 5 or 6 digits is usually sufficient to make sure you are using the correct address).

articles.name: How do I receive bitcoin cash in my BRD wallet?
articles.title: How do I receive bitcoin cash in my BRD wallet?
articles.body:
If you would like to receive bitcoin cash from someone, you will need to give them your receiving address. Follow these steps to find your bitcoin cash receiving address:

  1. On the main screen, tap Bitcoin Cash.
  2. At the bottom of the screen, tap Receive.
  3. Give the sending party your receiving address. There are a few ways to do this:
  • Show them the Receive Money screen in your wallet, and let them scan your QR code.
  • Press the Share button under the QR code to send them your address via email or text message.
  • Tap the QR code to copy your address to your device's memory. You can now paste your address into a website or other app.

You can also request for a specific amount by using the Request an Amount option.  Visit this page for information on how to use this.

The BRD wallet uses the "CashAddr" format for BCH addresses to protect customers from loss of funds. This is a new format that encodes your bitcoin cash address so you do not accidentally send bitcoin to a bitcoin cash address and vice versa.  If the wallet you are using to send bitcoin cash does not support this format yet, you may need to request for it or use an online resource to convert the CashAddr to a legacy address.

The addresses shown on your receive address will change every time you receive money, but old addresses will continue to work.

IMPORTANT: If bitcoin cash is sent to the wrong address, it can not be refunded. When sending or receiving bitcoins cash, always check to make sure the address being sent funds to is the same as the one that was given (comparing the first 5 or 6 digits is usually sufficient to make sure you are using the correct address).

articles.name: How long will it take for a bitcoin transaction to arrive in my BRD wallet?
articles.title: How long will it take for a bitcoin transaction to arrive in my BRD wallet?
articles.body:
Bitcoin transactions are processed by the bitcoin network in order to become confirmed. Transactions which pay a higher network fee get processed faster, and if your transaction is taking a long time to confirm it could mean the sender included a network fee that was too low.

Occasionally, even transactions that have paid an adequate fee can still take extra time to be processed by the network. We have no control over this process, and the only option is to wait for the network to process your transaction.

Your transaction will be marked "Pending" until it has received 6 confirmations on the network. Once the necessary confirmations have been received, the transaction will be marked "Complete".

The process of confirming transactions happens outside of your the BRD app and is not within our control.

If a transaction does not appear in your wallet, this may be due to one or more of the following reasons:

  • Your wallet needs to be synced to the blockchain. Click here to learn more about syncing your wallet.
  • Your incoming transaction has been dropped from the network. This can happen when the transaction remains unconfirmed for several weeks. When a transaction is dropped from the network, the funds are returned to the sender’s address. Ensuring that an adequate network transaction fee is attached to your transaction can help prevent this.
  • The funds you are expecting to receive in your BRD wallet have been mistakenly sent to the wrong address. Bitcoin transactions are irreversible so always make sure that the person sending you funds is using the correct address.

articles.name: How do I use the "Request an Amount" screen in my Bitcoin wallet?
articles.title: How do I use the "Request an Amount" screen in my Bitcoin wallet?
articles.body:
The QR code you use to receive money in your BRD Bitcoin wallet can contain only your bitcoin address, or it can also specify the amount of money that you wish to receive. If you use the Request an Amount feature, the amount of money you enter will be included in the QR code.

When someone scans your QR code, the amount to send will automatically be filled out, so the sender doesn’t have to enter it themselves. This makes it easier to specify how much bitcoin should be sent, and prevent mistakes when trying to receive a specific amount of bitcoin.

articles.name: How do I receive bitcoin in my BRD wallet?
articles.title: How do I receive bitcoin in my BRD wallet?
articles.body:
If you would like to receive bitcoin from someone, you will need to give them your bitcoin address. Follow these steps to find your bitcoin receiving address:

  1. On the main screen, tap Bitcoin.
  2. At the bottom of the screen, tap Receive.
  3. Give the sending party your receiving address. There are a few ways to do this:
  • Show them the "Receive Money" screen in your BRD app, and let them scan your QR code.
  • Press the "Share" button under the QR code to send them your address via email or text message.
  • Tap the QR code to copy your address to your device's memory. You can now paste your address into a website or other app.

You can also request for a specific amount by using the Request an Amount option. Visit this page for information on how to use this.

The bitcoin address shown on your receive address will change every time you receive money, but old addresses will continue to work.

Important: If bitcoin is sent to the wrong address, it can not be refunded. When sharing your address, always check to make sure the address you give out is the same as the one shown under your QR code (comparing the first 5 or 6 digits is usually sufficient to make sure you are using the correct address).

articles.name: What are the bitcoin transaction details?
articles.title: What are the bitcoin transaction details?
articles.body:
This screen shows details about the transaction:

Status

When sending with BRD, the recipient will usually receive the transaction in 10-60 minutes on the regular processing speed setting, 10-30 minutes on the priority setting and 1-24 hours on economy. For receiving, we have no control over how long it will take for the transaction to complete.

If the transaction status is "complete," then the transaction has successfully gone through. If this is a transaction you sent, the money is now in the wallet of the recipient. If this is a transaction you received, the money is now in your wallet, ready to be spent.

If the status is not yet complete, this will show the current progress.

Memo

Here you can attach a note to the transaction to remind yourself what it was for. This memo will not be shared with anyone else and is only visible to you, but you can edit it at any time, even after the transaction has completed.

Amount

This shows detailed information about how much bitcoin was sent, how much it was worth at the time, and other details about your balance.

Other

At the bottom of this screen you will find additional technical details about the transaction. The bitcoin transaction ID can be used as proof that a payment was made.

articles.name: Why did my bitcoin Receive Address change?
articles.title: Why did my bitcoin Receive Address change?
articles.body: Whenever you receive a payment to the bitcoin address shown, a new address is automatically generated for you. By using a unique address for every transaction, you can increase privacy and security. Old addresses will still continue to work, even if they are no longer displayed in your app.

articles.name: How can I send bitcoin?
articles.title: How can I send bitcoin?
articles.body:
In your BRD app, a wallet is created for the supported cryptocurrencies you own.  Follow these steps to send bitcoin from your wallet:

  1. On the main screen, tap Bitcoin.
  2. Tap Send at the bottom.
  3. Enter the address you are sending funds to.  There are several ways to do this:
    • Tap on Scan and scan the QR code from the receiving wallet.
    • Copy the receiving wallet’s address and paste it in the To field.
    • Manually type the recipient’s bitcoin address and double check to make sure that it is accurate.  Addresses are case sensitive.
  4. Enter the amount you would like to send.  For your convenience, you can toggle the amount to bitcoin or your local currency
  5. In the Processing Speed section, select your preferred network fee setting.
  6. Add a memo.  This is optional.  Memos are only visible to you and is not sent to the receiving party.
  7. Tap Send, verify that the transaction details are correct, and confirm the payment with your PIN or fingerprint.

Important: If bitcoin is sent to the wrong address, it can not be refunded. When sending bitcoin, always check to make sure the address you are sending to is the same as the one that was given to you (comparing the first 5 or 6 digits is usually sufficient to make sure you are using the correct address).

articles.name: Why does it cost money to send a bitcoin transaction?
articles.title: Why does it cost money to send a bitcoin transaction?
articles.body:
The BRD wallet does not charge any fees to send a transaction. However, the bitcoin network does require a fee, called a "transaction fee". This fee is calculated based on the amount of activity in your wallet, and is always displayed to you before you authorize a payment to be sent.

Wallets that receive many small payments before trying to send one large transaction may be charged a higher transaction fee. If possible, combining the payments you receive into a smaller number of larger transactions can keep your transaction fees low.

articles.name: Why is the value of bitcoin sent different than the value received?
articles.title: Why is the value of bitcoin sent different than the value received?
articles.body: Money in your BRD Bitcoin wallet is always held as bitcoin, and the value in your local currency is displayed as an estimate only. The exchange rate used to make this estimate is always fluctuating, and depending on when a transaction is sent or received the estimated value of the transaction can change. It is common for the estimated value of a transaction to be seen differently by the sender and receiver, however the amount of bitcoin sent should not change.
